Russell,
I'll answer between tyour lines.

Then does it have a package-private constructor?
Yes, The Message class has only one private constructor wich acpts parameters for all the fields of a Message object.

Can you instantiate the class at all? 
Not from outside the package, where my code under test is.

Is the Message class itself tied to the external
system?
Define "tied". The datasource client parses the strigs from the sockets and generates the Message's objects from within the Package.


 Can you write some test code in the same package to
instantiate and populate it?
yes. But I want my class to be in a different package (I guess I didn't understand this one)

Regards,
Santiago
